title: Isolation of single nuclei from postmortem fresh frozen human brain and immunostaining for NeuN
title_html: Isolation of single nuclei from postmortem fresh frozen human brain and immunostaining for NeuN

protocol.title: Isolation of single nuclei from postmortem fresh frozen human brain and immunostaining for NeuN

Prepare Homogenization Buffer and cool it on ice.

ABC
1AmountReagentFinal concentration
22925 µlIM1
33 µlDTT 1mM1 µM
430 µl50x Protease Inhibitor0.5 x
515 µlRNaseIN 40U/µl0.2 U/µl
630 µlTritonX100 10 %v/v0.1 %
Pre-cool the dounce tissue grinder on ice (Kimble Kontes all glass tissue grinder, 7 mL tubes, 0.02 - 0.056 mm clearance space between pestle and tubes)

Add
of Homogenization buffer to the dounce tissue grinder.

Collect the brain chunk (~
) and transfer to a Petri dish on ice.
Cut out into small pieces using a chilled scalpel or blade.
Transfer all pieces into the dounce tissue grinder.

Homogenize the tissue, on ice (~30 firm strokes).
Check on hematocytometer while homogenizing and adjust the number of strokes.

source.body: Too few strokes – you will see cell clumps; too many strokes – you will get damaged nuclei.

source.description:
Filter homogenate using 40 µm Corning cell strainer to remove clumps.
--> Take sample for hemocytometer.
Transfer the homogenate into two precooled 1.5 ml Eppendorf tubes.

Centrifuge at
for
at
.

Slowly aspirate the supernatant from the side of the tube.
Avoid disturbing the pellets, up to
of supernatant can be left.

Gently resuspend each pellet in
(final volume) of cold Homogenization buffer and pool both tubes (final volume
).

Add an equal volume of cold
.

source.body:
Critical! Be very exact with volumes. suspension + 50 % iod.
Final iodixanol concentration is 25 %.

source.description: Gently pipette mix.

Add an equal volume of 29 % iodixanol (
) into a 2 ml Eppendorf tube.
Slowly layer off the 25 % iodixanol suspension mix over the 25 % iodixanol, without mixing them.

Centrifuge at
for
at
.

Prepare buffer for immunostaining.
ABC
1AmountReagentFinal concentration
29400 µlRNase-free PBS (pH7.4)
3500 µlRNase-free 10 % BSA0.5 %
450 µl1 M MgCl25 mM
510 µlDNAse I (2000 U/ml)2 U/ml

ABC
1AmountReagentFinal concentration
29400 µlRNase-free PBS (pH7.4)
3500 µlRNase-free 10 % BSA0.5 %
450 µl1 M MgCl25 mM
510 µlDNAse I (2000 U/ml)2 U/ml
After centrifugation, remove and discard the top myelin-rich debris layer (you can use a 1 ml pipette with the tip cut, or cotton swabs).
Then, remove and discard the aqueous supernatant, without disrupting the nuclei pellet. Avoid contaminating with the top layer.
Use a small amount of buffer for Antibody Incubation to resuspend the pellet and transfer the solution to a new tube.

Gently resuspend in
of buffer for Antibody Incubation.

Incubate for
, at
or iced, for blocking nonspecific staining.
Take sample for hemocytometer.
Take a sample for unstained control. Take sample for 2AB-only (nonspecific binding control).

Add primary antibody (Ms-a-NeuN, 1:1000) and incubate on a rotator in cold room (
) for
.

source.body: Use Eppendorfs coated with BSA for collection (to coat the Eppendorf tubes, fill them with 10 % BSA solution in PBS for , rinse with PBS, and dry at overnight).

source.description:
Add
of buffer for Immunostaining and invert several times.

Centrifuge at
for
at
.

Carefully transfer all the supernatant (don’t leave any supernatant! It’s ok to drag some pellet) to a new Eppendorf tube and resuspend the pellet in
of buffer for Antibody Incubation.

Centrifuge the supernatant at
for
at
to recover non-pelleted nuclei.

Resuspend them in
of buffer for Antibody Incubation and pool for a final volume of 600 µl.
Take samples for single color staining.
Add secondary antibody (G-a-Ms Alexa Fluor 647, 1:1000) and Hoechst 33258 (5 µg/ml) to the same tube. (Hoechst 1:1000 of 2,5 mg/ml stock).
Check the quality of the sample and on hemocytometer.

source.body: For 100 mg of tissue, should have ~ 2 Million nuclei in ~0.6 ml.

source.description: Transfer to 7 ml culture tubes.
Place on ice and bring them to the FACS facility for sorting.

source.body:
FACS sorting controls:
Non-stained
2AB only
Single stainings

source.description: Collect in BSA coated Eppendorfs containing collection medium (containing ~1/5 of the expected final volume after collection).
Add BSA after collection for final 1% BSA final concentration (tested for 10x Chromium v2 and v3).

source.body: Different Single Cell assays tolerate different BSA concentrations, but lowering it may increase nuclei aggregation.

materials.name: Goat anti-Mouse IgG (H L) Alexa Fluor 647

description:
- Protocol based on Krishnaswami et al., Nat Protoc. 2016, 3:499-524
- Used routinely in our lab for the isolation of single nuclei from fresh frozen postmortem brains from subjects with neurodegenerative disorders and healthy controls for single-nucleus RNA-seq
- Works also for isolation of nuclei from fresh frozen mouse brains
- Used for isolation of all nuclei or antibody-enriched populations (i.e., NeuN+ nuclei)
- We always perform and strongly recommend FACS if used for single-nucleus RNA-seq
